name: Amazon Prime
description: $6.99-$7.49/month Prime membership (50% off) for students, young adults, or EBT/Medicaid recipients
fullDescription: Amazon offers discounted Prime memberships for students, young adults (18-24), and qualifying government assistance recipients, with rates starting at $6.99/month.
whatTheyOffer:
**Prime Student & Young Adult ($7.49/month):**
- For college students or ages 18-24
- 6-month free trial for new student members
- Free 2-day shipping on eligible items
- Prime Video, Prime Music, Prime Reading included

**Prime Access ($6.99/month):**
- For recipients of qualifying government assistance
- EBT, Medicaid, and other programs qualify
- Same full Prime benefits
- Re-verify eligibility every 12 months
howToGetIt:
1. Visit amazon.com/amazonprime and choose your plan
2. Prime Student: Verify with .edu email or enrollment documents
3. Young Adult (18-24): Verify age through ID verification
4. Prime Access: Verify EBT card or Medicaid status
5. All discounted plans include full Prime benefits
keywords: Amazon, Prime Student, Prime Access, young adult, student discount, EBT, SNAP, Medicaid, free shipping, Prime Video, college, university, 50% off, streaming, 18-24
